content: Hi @Carl Leitner I've downloaded the rc1 and compiled, but there are several things that are not completely clear to me yet ..
my understanding was that the guides would include the "full" certificate and "extracts" used for the QR
The extracts (two types ?) might disclose more or less infos depending on the usage
Am I correct that for the time being only the QR "extracts" are represented there ?
Are we going to include also the "complete" certificate ?

Hi @Giorgio Cangioli cleaning up the repo now, so there may be some more changes. What we will need is a an "digital SVC composition" which goes into the SVC registry and a "paper SVC composition" which represents the content on the physical card. the paper is what I think you mean by the extract, and the digital can contain more (e.g. lab tests). we are trying to keep the paper and digital on parity with each other for content, so that the digital svc composition. The content in the paper SVC composition (+ provenance, + bundle ID) is what should be what is QR encoded.
does this make sense, or add to the confusion ;-)
Thank Carl I'll get a look to the new version..
I think what we will want is a structure map from SVC Composition into IPS Composition.
and another structure map from "something" into the SVC Composition & Bundle where that something represents the data fields required for encoding into the QR-code.
This something could be a questionnaire (and then we can use SDC to do the mapping into a bundle) but not sure this is the right fit.
